page.title: 08FARMS IN THE CARTERTON AREA
page.content: {Farmers}expressed concern that they sometimes suffered unfairly from{ {public criticism}and they welcomed the chance to show groups of children around their farms and explain how they reared animals and grew crops. They felt that the use of{chemicals, within government guildlines, improved their productivity and controlled pests.{Straw burning}was unpopular in the town but was done because there was no market for straw and it did not rot easily when ploughed into clay. They were trying to preserve{hedges}and replant{trees in the area. We noticed some{footpaths had been absorbed into{arable}land but access was usually possible along the hedgerows. Our visits gave us the opportunity to see, touch and smell the animals. One group even had the thrill of seeing a piglet born!
